title: Define Project Scope and Requirements (Revised)
description: This RFC outlines the process of gathering and documenting project requirements, scope, and objectives for the AI-assisted digital forensics system. The focus areas include: data sources to be analyzed (e.g., disk images, network traffic logs, email archives, mobile device data, cloud storage data), desired outputs or evidence to be identified (e.g., malware signatures, suspicious file transfers, communication patterns, data exfiltration attempts), performance and scalability requirements (e.g., ability to handle petabytes of data, parallel processing capabilities, distributed computing infrastructure, response times under specific scenarios), legal or regulatory constraints (data privacy laws, chain of custody requirements, admissibility of evidence in court, compliance with relevant forensics standards), expected integration points with existing forensics tools or workflows, user interface and reporting capabilities (user-friendly design, customizable reports, visualizations for easy understanding), potential areas for machine learning model development and improvement (explainable AI, transfer learning, ensemble methods, real-time analysis), considerations for security and ethical implications (data encryption, anonymization, consent management, bias mitigation strategies), a roadmap for the project's development lifecycle, and the involvement of representatives from law enforcement agencies, data analysts, legal teams, cybersecurity experts, and end users throughout this process. It is crucial to involve a technical writer to document the process and ensure clarity and comprehensibility. This updated RFC will guide the design, development, testing, and deployment phases of the project. Upon completion, a comprehensive document detailing these items will be available for review and feedback. This RFC has been reviewed by relevant stakeholders and is now ready for implementation. For task decomposition, it's recommended to create separate tasks for each focus area mentioned above. The defined scope and requirements will serve as the basis for task creation. However, I suggest adding a specific task for 'Performance Benchmarking' under performance and scalability requirements, to ensure that the system can handle real-world scenarios effectively. This updated RFC is now ready for the Project Manager to assign tasks based on the defined scope and requirements.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, and integration points.

title: Develop Data Ingestion and Preprocessing
description: Implement mechanisms for ingesting and preprocessing large volumes of data from various sources.

title: Build AI Models for Evidence Identification
description: Develop and train AI models for identifying relevant evidence from the ingested data.

title: Create User Interface and Reporting
description: Design and implement the user interface and reporting mechanisms for presenting identified evidence to investigators.

title: Implement Data Storage and Management
description: Set up secure and scalable data storage and management solutions for ingested data and identified evidence.

title: Establish Security and Compliance Measures
description: Implement security measures and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards for handling sensitive data.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deployment of the system.

title: Conduct System Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Perform comprehensive testing, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, to ensure system quality and reliability.
dependencies: Build AI Models for Evidence Identification

title: Document System Architecture and Usage
description: Create comprehensive documentation for the system architecture, components, and usage guidelines.
